activities.loc: Courtroom D, Fourth Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marquis Matthew Maier

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on December 7, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Activity: Arraignment 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

3:20 PM Defendant Marquis Matthew Maier appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ryan W O'Hara appeared by attorney Cuco Longfforia by video for Marquis Matthew Maier.  Prosecuting attorney Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Information filed, copy to Defendant's attorney, reading waived. Defendant's attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.

Activity: Preliminary hearing 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

8:45 AM Prosecuting attorney Cheniqua White appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Marquis Matthew Maier appeared in person, in custody.  Attorney Ryan W O'Hara appeared in person for Marquis Matthew Maier. Officer Maureen Rebhorn of the Janesville Police Department sworn testimony taken in person; Witness identified the defendant. State moves for bind over, defense objects without argument. Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information.
Arraignment scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 15, 2022 at 08:45 am.

3:09 PM Prosecuting attorney David S Olson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Marquis Matthew Maier appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ryan W O'Hara appeared by video for Marquis Matthew Maier. Parties request new preliminary hearing date.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 1, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Activity: Adjourned initial appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

3:06 PM Prosecuting attorney Emmeline Lee appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Marquis Matthew Maier appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ryan W O'Hara appeared by video for Marquis Matthew Maier. Preliminary hearing requested in person. Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 8:45 AM. Bond to continue.

records.addlTxt: Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Risk Report

3:22 PM Prosecuting attorney Cheniqua White appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Marquis Matthew Maier appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Anna Elizabeth Hartz appeared by video for Marquis Matthew Maier. Defendant address and date of birth verified. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Cash bond set of $750 with conditions.  May not possess any weapons. No contact with 2300 Block of Harvard Dr. in Janesville, WI. Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
No contact with 2300 block of Harvard Drive, possess no weapons, Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody.
